snippet: As cicadas overrun signs, lawns and porches across the region, most homeowners seem resigned to wait out the few weeks of infestation.
abstract: Hotly anticipated arrival of 17-year cicadas has been dismissed by many in New York City as the plague that did not happen, but their buzz sounds are as cacophonous as ever in places north of the city; some residents have contracted power washers to blast bodies off their porches as bugs, which live above ground for just a few weeks before mating and dying, leave their brown casings everywhere.
lead_paragraph: As cicadas overrun signs, lawns and porches across the region, most homeowners seem resigned to wait out the few weeks of infestation.

headline.seo: Not Much Love in the Air for Swarm of Mating Cicadas
headline.main: An Invasion of 17-Year-Olds, Loud, Lusty and Six-Legged
headline.print_headline: An Invasion of 17-Year-Olds, Loud, Lusty and Six-Legged
